WorkItem.Description:
Yes, this has been posted by other people before.
however, even though they were closed months ago, with a comment that 'fixed in commit ####' I am still seeing 0 DPS 
(at least on my shadow priest that I have attached below) on both 2.3.14 and on the open beta 3 webpage
Â 
I understand that this item (and some other Burst items) share a cooldown that is complex to code, but shouldn't at least One ticket remain 'open' until this IS dealt with?
WorkItem.Summary: [ShadowPriest] Hand-Mounted Pyro Rocket shown as 0 DPS

Comments.Message: I don't recall this issue ever having been opened for Shadow Priests. Hunters, Warriors, etc sure but not a Shadow.

ok, true.  I was under the (possibly false) impression that the issue was in the base code, not a specific Spec.  since you seem to be indicating that this is a Class-spec issue, then I am glad I opened the ticket.

I think I have skipped adding this purposefully because even back when haste was bad for Shadow, it was still better than Pyro rockets. Unless you can come up with a good reason for me to add it beyond completeness, I'll try to get it fixed when I have time.

Damage procs from certain items or enchants are globally defined in Rawr.Base, but it's up to each model to decide which of the damageprocs are worthwhile and to actually implement the mechanics beind them.

it's worthwhile to provide all of the damage procs, even if only because it's not hard to do, and it's something that has been around since classic and is still being used in new gear items.

"On hit: chance to cause xxx shadow/fire/nature/arcane/frost/holy damage"

ok, TNSe asked for a reason to add this in, so:
damage competitive and better than that of standard enchants (~48 DPS) Which, when I compare it to many other Enchants-Hands, seems to be top, or near top of the list.
oh, and it should be able to Spell crit as well. thus, even more than 48dps
Fixed, should be in for next release.
